abstract: "Hark! A Vagrant," by Kate Beaton, who got noticed for her Web cartoons about literary, political and historical figures, leads the hardcover best seller list for graphic books.
snippet: "Hark! A Vagrant," by Kate Beaton, who got noticed for her Web cartoons about literary, political and historical figures, leads the hardcover best seller list for graphic books.
lead_paragraph: The best-seller lists are aflutter with change this week. The hardcover list leads off with "Hark! A Vagrant," by Kate Beaton, who became noticed for her Web cartoons about literary, political and historical figures. Click on this link for a humorous interpretation of the discovery of Canada. "Hark!" is published by Drawn & Quarterly, which also has "Daybreak," an art-house take on the zombie genre by Brian Ralph, at No. 6.

headline.main: Graphic Books Lists Features New Titles
